answers.answer: Hi, at this it is unlikely to be a joint or bony pain; probably it is related with either neuropathy, muscles or vascular. Did you took some long walk or prolonged standing recently? Did you ever get your vitamin B levels done? Do you smoke?Any history of diabetes? Vitamin B deficiency could also lead to peripheral neuropathy. Try pain killers for 3-4 days along with massage. If no relief is seen, do consult doctor. Please get blood potassium, CK along with vitamin B levels done.Rest as much as  possible.Elevate your leg.Apply ice for up to 15 minutes. Do this 4 times per day, more often for the first few days.Gently stretch and massage cramping muscles.Take over-the-counter pain medications like acetaminophen or ibuprofen.

thank you for your comments.  I don't smoke , nor did I go for long walks etc recently. No history of diabetes.Your idea about the Vitamin B deficiency or potassium sounds like it could be it.  I've never had these aches before but I was on vitamin B supplements a few years ago  under doctors instructions and was slightly low in potassium about 4-5 months ago but, like i said, i have never experienced these sorts of pain.I appreciate your advice and hopefully the pains will go away within the next few days.

question: I am a 36 year old female.  About 2 days nites ago i was kept awake most of the nite with throbbing pain down both legs.  It has continued since and is sometimes so painful i feel like crying.  The pain is like a costant throbbing pain down the front of both legs but mainly around the knees and sometimes when i stand it feels like my legs are about to give way. Has anyone ever experienced this before?
title: PAIN DOWN BOTH LEGS, WHAT IS IT?
